captions.text:
From the studio that finally learned how to
make Pixar movies

and the songwriting duo behind “Hasa Diga
Eebowai”

Comes the feature-length music video for “Let
it Go”--

It’s been three years since the last Disney
musical,
and 18 years since the last good Disney musical.

Now, the big D is back and adjusted for inflation,
with

Welcome to Arendelle, a magical-ish Scandanavian-ish
country that’s

been cursed with eternal winter
... even though their main export is ice.

Meet Elsa, a manic-depressive princess with
a confusing set of powers, like
They kinda gloss over that one.

Fall in love with her adorkable sister Anna
Who spends 3 years of her adult life shut

inside a castle...
even though she could leave at any time.

And who could forget the completely unnecessary,
unexplained, magical

When disaster strikes, watch Anna save the
day by teaming up with

Experience a clever twist on past Disney films
that teaches girls they don’t need a prince

to rescue them, because all men are disgusting
loners
Or lying manipulative power hungry sociopaths.

So gather the family and sing along on a musical
journey that’s all

The 
song that sounds like it’s from Wicked

The anthropomorphic sidekick’s comic relief
song
The one you don’t know the words to
and the wickedly talented Adele Dazeem

You don't need true love to thaw a frozen
heart:

Just soak it in water for a few hours. Works
on turkeys.

Hey, Screen Junkies
Can't get enough of my buttery voice?

Then check out Honest Game Trailers
over on Smosh Games.

Click the box to check out our honest take
on Mario Kart.

comments.text:
I've noticed that a lot of people are HATERS! I personally LOVE this 
movie... some might not like it! This is fine with me! Just please stop 
pointing out flaws and be NICE! 

It's not like it's going to kill you to stop hating! It's supposed to be 
for kids(except for the joke 'What Size does it matter'). I'm turning 13 
and I sing Let it Go a lot(annoying my sister mostly), but please just stop 
the hate and think of Olaf!

Olaf is cute and funny, I noticed someone hates him in the comments! I 
guess it's 'cool' to hate. 
I know I might get lots of feed back from this like hate responses and 
stuff but please! 

Stop the hate and spread the love!😊😊😊❤️❤️❤️
-CatGurl﻿

like an apology, but these things will never happen. Sorry.

comments.author: Kevin Yang

comments.text:
It's kind of sad that kids will worship this cliche movie yet they will 
never know how artistic classic Disney films are. I volunteer at a local 
library and when we had movie day and watched Snow White, kids were 
literally calling it boring and bad compared to Frozen. It just shows how 
easy it is to win kids over. The only good movie Disney made in this decade 
was Tangled. ﻿
comments.author: Kaoru Belphegor (DeathWaltz)

comments.text:
+Kaoru Belphegor I'm pretty sure kids don't know how artistic any disney 
movie is though... They just care about being entertained, which is totally 
normal. I loved Disney movies as a kid, but I didn't really start 
appreciating them and the art of animation until I grew older. Seriously, 
just let kids enjoy what they want.
comments.author: seriouslybored11

comments.text:
+Kaoru Belphegor I'm pretty sure kids don't know how artistic any disney 
movie is though... They just care about being entertained, which is totally 
normal. I loved Disney movies as a kid, but I didn't really start 
appreciating them and the art of animation until I grew older. Seriously, 
just let kids enjoy what they want.
comments.author: seriouslybored11

comments.text:
+Kaoru Belphegor No, sorry. Snow White is actually just that boring and bad 
XD Animation and voice acting were of the highest quality of that time, but 
kids don't care about that, because that's behind the scenes stuff. What 
they see is very little by way of humour, a comparatively dull colour 
palette, a plot with no surprises and extremely undeveloped characters. 
Plus the songs are boring.


Next time you do movie day, try some better Disney movies. Lion King is 
always a good choice. The Jungle Book is wonderful as well. Kids love 
Maleficent from Sleeping Beauty. Lady and the Tramp, A Bug's Life, The 
Little Mermaid, Aladdin...


Actually, literally anything Disney except Snow White. You'll see that most 
of the stuff I suggested is animal-heavy as well. I think kids can relate 
to Frozen well because it's an everyone thing, instead of a girl's only 
kind of deal. Disney's animal movies have great characterization, and all 
kids typically love them. The Lion King in particular. It gets very, very 
real and teaches kids about consequences, responsibility, family and love.


And guys, stop hating on Frozen, yeesh. It's not the best movie out there, 
it's cliched as hell and I don't really enjoy it much either. But they're 
growing up with this like you grew up with the classics. Personal taste and 
experiences matter. Things that Frozen did beautifully were the 
environment, animation, humour and some decent action sequences. Credit 
where credit's due.
comments.author: TK SI

comments.text:
+Kaoru Belphegor You should have shown The Lion King instead on that day. 
Most people love that film and those kids would too. Or your library didn't 
have it. I'm sorry for you. Kids today have no respect for classics. If 
they like Frozen so much, so be it. Let them enjoy their cliché movie named 
Frozen while you, me, and all Anti-Frozen fans enjoy Classics such as The 
Lion King, Beauty and the Beast, The Little Mermaid, Aladdin, and every 
single Disney movie not named Frozen.

and I, Let it Go = Defying Gravity, the list goes on...﻿

comments.author: JFUNNY

comments.text:
Even though I like frozen I can honestly say that it had a lot of plot 
holes. Through the whole movie I had no idea where Elsa's power came 
from(if they did mention it I didn't hear). From all the movies I've 
watched the villains are the ones who either creates the problem or the one 
creates a huge and I mean huge obstacle for the problem to be solved and I 
didn't see that in frozen. To me the prince is not really interesting. 
Whenever I watch a movie it may seems crazy but I always have mixed feeling 
towards the villain. I never fully hate them. I hate/love them(except in 
some few very movies). I just didn't feel anything towards the prince he 
was just a character that was just there. I really liked that they were 
trying to show the sister sister love thing but they should have gone with 
their first idea at making Elsa the main villain. The prince and the other 
Gillian's should have still be there but you know Elsa would have been the 
big hit. Also I think gif Elsa was the main villain it would have proved 
how strong their sisterly love is. Anna would have had to go through much 
more obstacles to save Elsa and her determination would also show her love 
and how strong she is as a person. By then everybody would have hated Elsa. 
Everyone would take every chance they get to kill her and I think they 
would have even tried to kill Anna. If I'm not wrong I think they were 
trying to pass the message that girls don't need a man to do something well 
by Anna going against everybody to save her sister this would have showed 
it. Throughout the movie Anna showed a characteristic of innocence and I 
after all this trauma (Elsa rejecting her,the guys who she thought she love 
turned out to be a bad guy,and he people going against her just to try to 
kill her sister) she would have gone through she would showed a huge 
character development. Of course she would have still been the same old Ana 
we all know and love but she would have learned a lot through her journey. 
And in the end it would be really cool to see the prince be a really 
interesting villain and we see Elsa, Anna and the guy,the reindeer and 
snowmen gam up against him. It would show teamwork and friendship. Although 
there were plot hole in the movie what I really wanted to say was that it 
doesn't deserve all the hate it gets. Frozen is a really cool movie. It's 
not an over the sky too amazing beautiful perfect movie but it's great. I 
heard there's gonna be a sequel I hope it tells how Elsa get's her powers. 
It would be cool to see some legends and real action and I want Elsa to 
find real love because in frozen it almost seemed lie, sje didn't belive in 
love and I would like to see her not being so cold towards people. ﻿

My biggest problem with the movie was the King's staggeringly stupid and

locked in the attic for ten years.﻿
